Row.Text: Corporations
Corporations Home Page
Corporations
[NEWLINE]"If you don't drive your business, you will be driven out of business."[NEWLINE] - B.C. Forbes[NEWLINE]

Trade and commerce has been a focal point of civilization since ancient times. Corporations are modern entities that authorizes a company or single group to act as a single entity. Corporations have become the largest facilitators of trade and influence in today's society. In Civilization V, Corporations allow you cement your civilization's wealth and deliver powerful trade benefits to your civilization.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To establish a Corporation, you must secure a Global Monopoly on any of its required resources, and found its Corporation Headquarters. After your Corporation is established, you may construct Offices in your cities and use them to build Franchises in foreign cities via [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes.
Corporation
Headquarters
Office
Franchise
Free Trade Routes
Resource Bonus
Office Bonus
Trade Route Bonus
Provides {1_Num} {2_IconString} {3_ResourceName}
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Modifier for Corporation: {1_Num}%
Monopoly Required (Any)
Monopoly Resource
Corporations and Monopolies
Founding Corporations
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_FOUNDING}

In order to establish a Corporation, you need to construct its associated Headquarters in one of your cities, and the Corporation must not be actively founded by another civilization. Headquarters may only be established after you have a Global Monopoly on one of its required Monopoly Resources. Once you've constructed the Headquarters, you will automatically found the Corporation and immediately receive its Corporation benefits. You also receive a free Office in the city that constructed it. You can only establish one Corporation at a time, so choose carefully!
How do I found a Corporation?
Destroying Corporations
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_DESTROYING}

When a city that has constructed a Corporation Headquarters is acquired or destroyed through any means by another civilization, that Corporation is immediately destroyed. All Offices and Franchises around the world are immediately closed, and the founding Civilization immediately loses all benefits from that Corporation. It is extremely important to protect your Corporation, as you will lose all of your progress in spreading that Corporation![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A destroyed Corporation immediately becomes available to be founded again by any civilization in the world. There is no restriction in the number of times a Corporation may be established in a game.
How do I destroy a Corporation?
Offices
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_OFFICES}

Offices can be established in any of your empire's cities after you've established a Corporation. Offices allow you to spread your Corporation through [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes. Each [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route you establish from a city with an Office to a foreign city without your Corporation's Franchise will spread your Corporation's Franchise to that city at the completion of the [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route. In addition to a base effect, each Office has a benefit that stacks based on the number of Franchises you've established in foreign cities. The more Offices you own in the empire, the faster your Corporation can spread. Spread your Corporation to enhance its benefit to your Civilization!
What is an office?
Franchises
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_FRANCHISES}

Franchises cannot be constructed in any city. Instead they are created after a [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route from a city you own with an Office to a foreign city that does not already contain your Corporation's Franchise is completed. Franchises increase the Empire's overall Office benefit, so use them to strengthen your Corporation's effect. You can only build a maximum number of Franchises, determined by the size of the map, the number of [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes you can establish, and any bonuses from any [ICON_CULTURE] Social Policies you have unlocked.
What are franchises?
Monopolies
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_MONOPOLIES}

Monopolies represent the amount of a particular Luxury or Strategic Resource you own vs. the amount of that resource on the map. As you obtain more copies of a resource, your Monopoly Percentage will increase. If you obtain 50% or more of a Monopoly over a resource, you obtain a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global Monopoly[ENDCOLOR] over that resource. Obtaining a Global Monopoly grants a unique bonus per resource, so you should make it a priority to obtain Monopolies over as many Resources as possible.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Due to the vast abundance of Strategic Resources, it can be difficult to obtain a 50% Monopoly over a Strategic Resource. Because of this, you can also obtain a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT] Strategic Monopoly[ENDCOLOR] at 25% Monopoly, which grants a special combat bonus (different for each resource). You can still achieve a Global Monopoly at 50% Monopoly for a Strategic Resource.
What are Monopolies?
Spreading your Corporation
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_SPREAD}

You can spread your Corporation through [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes from a city with your Corporation's Office built to a foreign city without a Corporation Franchise built. At the completion of the [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route, a Franchise will be constructed.
How do I spread my Corporation?
Resource Bonus
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_RESOURCE_BONUS}

Most Corporations have a resource bonus which applies to all Cities with a Corporation Headquarters and Office. Each resource bonus provides a bonus to a specific yield, such as [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, or [ICON_RESEARCH] Science. These bonuses stack, so a city with a Corporation HQ and Office will receive double the bonus.
What is a resource bonus?
Office Bonus
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_OFFICE_BONUS}
Your Corporation Offices receive incremental affects the more Franchises you establish in foreign cities, so be sure to keep spreading your Corporation to reap its benefits!
What is an office bonus?
Trade Route Bonus
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_TRADE_ROUTE_BONUS}

All Corporations provide some benefit to your [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes. These bonuses generally affect your [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade benefits to cities that have your Corporation Franchise already established, but they may also grant some sort of special benefit (like increase trade distance, or invulnerable trade units).
What is a trade route bonus?

You have founded [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_CorporationName}[ENDCOLOR]! To spread your new Corporation far and wide, build Corporate Offices in owned Cities and send [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes from these Cities to foreign Cities!
Corporation Founded!

{1_PlayerName} has founded [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_CorporationName}[ENDCOLOR]! This Corporation can no longer be established unless the other player's Corporation Headquarters is destroyed (on city capture).
{1_PlayerName} has founded a Corporation!
{@1_BldgName} spreads to {@2_City}!
{@2_BldgName} has spread to the City of {@1_City} as a result of a Trade Route with {@3_City}. This will increase the value of all of your Corporate Offices!
{@1_BldgName} spreads to {@2_City}!
{@2_BldgName}, a foreign Corporation, has spread to the City of {@1_City} as a result of a Trade Route with {@3_City}. This will increase the value of their Corporation!
{@1_BldgName} spreads to {@2_City}!
{@2_BldgName} has spread to the City of {@1_City} as a result of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Transnationalism[ENDCOLOR] Policy. This will increase the value of all of your Corporate Offices!
{@1_BldgName} spreads to {@2_City}!

{@2_BldgName}, a foreign Corporation, has spread to the City of {@1_City} as a result of {@1_CivName}'s [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Transnationalism[ENDCOLOR] Policy. This will increase the value of their Corporation!
{@1_BldgName} relocates to {@2_City}!
{@2_BldgName} has relocated to the City of {@1_City} as a result of the previous HQ being captured! Try not to let this happen again, okay?
{@1_BldgName} closes all offices and franchises!
{@1_BldgName} has closed all global offices and franchises as a result of their headquarter's untimely destruction.
[NEWLINE]{1_BuildingName:textkey} cannot be constructed while you are constructing {2_BuildingName:textkey} elsewhere in your Empire.

The maximum number of Franchises you can create is a factor of the number of [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes you can establish and World Size. Ideology Tenets can also modify this number, and in some cases allow you to exceed your Franchise maximum.

Corporations

Corporations are powerful, late-game entities that are only available to Civilizations with Global Resource Monopolies. For more information, see the Civilopedia Concepts section on Coroporations, and the Wonders tab.

[ICON_MINUS] Foreign Corporations

List of Foreign Corporations and their total worldwide Franchises.
Monopolies & Corporations
Corporations

The word "corporation" derives from corpus, the Latin word for body, or a body of people. By the time of Justinian (reigned 527–565), Roman Law recognized a range of corporate entities under the names universitas, corpus or collegium. These included the state itself (the populus Romanus), municipalities, and such private associations as sponsors of a religious cult, burial clubs, political groups, and guilds of craftsmen or traders. Such bodies commonly had the right to own property and make contracts, to receive gifts and legacies, to sue and be sued, and, in general, to perform legal acts through representatives. Private associations were granted designated privileges and liberties by the emperor.
Allows you to found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations[ENDCOLOR], which are powerful late-game institutions that greatly enhance your Trade Routes and global power if you invest in their expansion.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The point is ladies and gentlemen that greed, for lack of a better word, is good."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Gordon Gekko[NEWLINE][TAB]
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nationalization[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Corporate Offices (up to your Global Franchise limit) function as Franchises. Foreign Franchises no longer benefit your Corporation.
Nationalization

Nationalization is the process of taking a private industry or private assets into public ownership by a national government or state. Nationalization usually refers to private assets, but may also mean assets owned by lower levels of government, such as municipalities, being transferred to be the state. The opposite of nationalization is usually privatization or de-nationalization, but may also be municipalization. Industries that are usually subject to nationalization include transport, communications, energy, banking and natural resources.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Transnationalism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Each turn, there is a chance that a Corporate Franchise will appear in a foreign City. Global Franchise maximum increased by 20%.
Transnationalism

Transnationalism as an economic process involves the global reorganization of the production process, in which various stages of the production of any product can occur in various countries, typically with the aim of minimizing costs. Economic transnationalism, commonly known as Globalization, was spurred in the latter half of the 20th century by the development of the internet and wireless communication, as well as the reduction in global transportation costs caused by containerization. Multinational corporations could be seen as a form of transnationalism, in that they seek to minimize costs, and hence maximize profits, by organizing their operations in the most efficient means possible irrespective of political boundaries.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Syndicalism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Corporate Franchises count double in the Cities of Civilizations you are at least [COLOR_MAGENTA]Popular[ENDCOLOR] with. Does not count against Global Franchise maximum.
Syndicalism

National syndicalism is an adaptation of syndicalism to suit the social agenda of integral nationalism. National syndicalism suggests that the people must defend themselves through the development of Syndicalist sections into massive economic worker movements. These should take immediate action to expropriate the capitalists. These should also take direct action to let the workers lead the production and to form peoples communes. National syndicalism seeks out principled reasons for direct economic action and denounces parliamentary action by representatives. The goal is not to make capitalism bearable, but the realisation of a free Nationalist and Socialist nation. National syndicalism aims to move the attention from the political terrain to the economic terrain. It wants the socialisation from the basis: a system of distribution from local units, in consultation with the National federation, on the fundament of a production and consumption statistic. As well as the organisation of the production by national industrial federations.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I don't build in order to have clients. I have clients in order to build."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Howard Roark[NEWLINE][TAB]
Trader Sid's, Inc.
Provides benefits geared toward [ICON_GOLD] Gold generation. Caravansaries in all Cities produce +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.

[ICON_RES_CLOVES] Cloves, [ICON_RES_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RES_NUTMEG] Nutmeg, [ICON_RES_PEPPER] Pepper, [ICON_RES_SALT] Salt, [ICON_RES_SPICES] Spices, [ICON_RES_SUGAR] Sugar provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in all Cities with a Trader Sid's HQ and Office.
+4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every Global Franchise.
[ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to foreign Cities with a Trader Sid's Franchise produce +50% [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Current Office Bonus: +{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Trader Sid's Headquarters

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

Construct this building in one of your cities to found the Trader Sid's Corporation, focused around generating large amounts of [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the empire. Remember that each Civilization may only found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]one[ENDCOLOR] Corporation, so make sure the benefits are applicable to your Victory Strategy!
Founds the Trader Sid's, Inc. Corporation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive a free Trader Sid's Office in this City, and unlocks construction of Trader Sid's Offices in owned Cities.
Trader Sid's

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

This building can only be constructed in Foreign Cities if you were the founder of Trader Sid's. To construct this building in a foreign City, send a Trade Route from an owned City with a Trader Sid's Office in it to a foreign City. When the Trade Route is complete, the building will automatically be constructed.
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to all Monopoly Resources worked by this City that are associated with Trader Sid's. Generates revenue for Trader Sid's Offices in the founding Civilization's Cities.
Trader Sid's Office

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

When a [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route between a foreign City and this City completes, a Trader Sid's Franchise is constructed in the foreign City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trader Sid's cannot be sold or destroyed by the player, and increases the [ICON_GOLD] Gold output of all Trader Sid's Offices by +4.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot have more Franchises than the maximum of possible [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes supported by your empire.

+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to all Monopoly Resources worked by this City that are associated with Trader Sid's. +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every Trader Sid's Franchise (up to your Franchise Limit).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trade Routes to foreign Cities with a Trader Sid's Franchise produce +50% [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
LandSea Extractors, Inc.
Provides benefits geared toward [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production generation. Harbors and Seaports in all Cities produce +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
[ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses, [ICON_RES_WHALE] Whales, [ICON_RES_CRAB] Crab, [ICON_RES_IVORY] Ivory provide +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in cities with LandSea Extractors HQ and Office.
+3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every Global Franchise.
[ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to a foreign City with a LandSea Extractors Franchise grant +10% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science rate in the origin City.
Current Office Bonus: +{1_Num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
LandSea Extractors Headquarters

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

Construct this building in one of your cities to found the LandSea Extractor's Corporation, focused around increasing you empire's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Remember that each Civilization may only found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]one[ENDCOLOR] Corporation, so make sure the benefits are applicable to your Victory Strategy!

When the Trade Route is complete, the building will automatically be constructed.

Hexxon Refinery, Inc.

Provides benefits geared toward enhancing your ability to wage late-game warfare. +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for all Units that require [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil or [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium to build.
+1 additional [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil and [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal for every three Global Franchises.
[ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to a foreign City with a Hexxon Refinery Franchise grant +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes move at double speed.
Current Office Bonus: +{1_Num} [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil and [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal.
Hexxon Refineries Headquarters

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Construct this building in one of your cities to found the Hexxon Refineries Corporation, focused around providing access to important late-game Strategic Resources such as [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil and [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal. Remember that each Civilization may only found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]one[ENDCOLOR] Corporation, so make sure the benefits are applicable to your Victory Strategy!

+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture on all Monopoly Resources associated with Giorgio Armeier. +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for every Giorgio Armeier Franchise (up to your Franchise Limit).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Every Trade Route from this City to a foreign City with a Giorgio Armeier Franchise increases this City's [ICON_CULTURE] Culture rate by +10%.
Firaxite Materials, Inc.
Provides benefits geared toward [ICON_RESEARCH] Science generation. Factories in all Cities produce +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
[ICON_RES_IRON] Iron, [ICON_RES_ALUMINUM] Aluminum, [ICON_RES_MARBLE] Marble, [ICON_RES_COPPER] Copper, [ICON_RES_PORCELAIN] Porcelain provide +3 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
+3 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every Global Franchise.

[ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to foreign Cities with a Firaxite Materials Franchise produce double [ICON_RESEARCH] Science. [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes cannot be pillaged, except as a result of a Declaration of War.
Current Office Bonus: +{1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Firaxite Materials Headquarters

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

Construct this building in one of your cities to found the Firaxite Materials Corporation, focused around improving your Empire's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science. Remember that each Civilization may only found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]one[ENDCOLOR] Corporation, so make sure the benefits are applicable to your Victory Strategy!
Founds the Firaxite Materials Corporation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive a free Firaxite Materials Office in this City, and unlocks construction of Firaxite Materials Offices in owned Cities.
Firaxite Materials

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

This building can only be constructed in Foreign Cities if you were the founder of Firaxite Materials. To construct this building in a foreign City, send a Trade Route from an owned City with a Firaxite Materials Office in it to a foreign City. When the Trade Route is complete, the building will automatically be constructed.
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to all Monopoly Resources worked by this City that are associated with Firaxite Materials. Generates revenue for Firaxite Materials Offices in the founding Civilization's Cities.
Firaxite Materials Office

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

When a [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route between a foreign City and this City completes, a Firaxite Materials Franchise is constructed in the foreign City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Firaxite Materials cannot be sold or destroyed by the player, and increases the [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output of all Firaxite Materials Offices by +3.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot have more Franchises than the maximum of possible [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes supported by your empire.

+20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when constructing Buildings in this City. +3 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every Firaxite Materials Franchise (up to your Franchise Limit).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trade Routes to foreign Cities with a Firaxite Materials Franchise produce +100% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
TwoKay Foods, Inc.
Provides benefits geared toward [ICON_FOOD] Food generation. Grocers in all Cities produce +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
[ICON_RES_WINE] Wine, [ICON_RES_TRUFFLES] Truffles, [ICON_RES_CITRUS] Citrus provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
+3 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every Global Franchise.

[ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to foreign Cities with a TwoKay Foods Franchise grant +10% [ICON_FOOD] Food to the origin City. [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes have +1 Sight and reveal Fog of War.
Current Office Bonus: +{1_Num} [ICON_FOOD] Food.
